precautions: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician

title: Cicatrin 20G Powder 1x1 (P)
details: It is used to treat certain types of infections caused by Bacteria. It can be used to treat certain skin infections and to prevent infections in burns, minor cuts, and wounds.
precautions: Cicatrin is not suitable for patients with hepatic or renal impairment. Cicatrin is considered to be toxic when applied near the ear so avoid using it around the ear and at times it can also increase sensitization. Avoid using the powder on large areas of affected or damaged skin.
effects: Itching, Pain, Skin rash, Scaling, Swelling, Redness, or other Signs of Skin irritation not present before use of this medication.

title: Umbillica 10G Gel
details: The use of the gel provides antiseptic treatment and gradually dries the umbilical cord.
precautions: Before using chlorhexidine, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. External use only. Avoid direct contact with the eyes or mucous membranes. Avoid applying over large surfaces. Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Irritation, sensitization, Allergic reactions

title: Fusil 5G Cream
details: Fusil cream is a prescribed medicine and is composed of fusidic acid topical. It is containing fusidic acid as an active ingredient. It belongs to the medicine category of the anti-bacterial class. This medicine was marketed by the Tabros Pharma PVT READ MORE
precautions: Fusil cream precautions are listed below.Inform the doctor about your past medical history before using this cream if it has a connection with the current one.If you are taking herbal or any other supplements, then you should inform the doctor about their usage.If you have any allergic problem such as skin rashes, itching, swelling problem from any of the Fusil Cream ingredients, then aware the doctor about it,Always wash your hands before applying the Fusil Cream to your skin.Do not exceed the course duration of more than ten days unless the doctor suggests youAfter applying this cream, if you feel drowsiness, then try to avoid the use of heavy machinery such as driving, etc. also, if your blood pressure falls, and then avoid driving any type of vehicle.Consult the doctor is necessary while using this cream in case of pregnancy and breastfeeding.Avoid recommending or sharing your medicine with other people if you do not know their medical condition.Check the expiry date of the cream before applying to the affected region; otherwise, it can cause adverse and serious side effects.Keep the medicine away from children's reach. Also, if you want to store it, keep its temperature less than 25-degree centigrade.This products should not be used by anyone who is, Allergic to fusidic acid and its salts or to any of the ingredients of this medication or is Allergic to lanolin (for the ointment form only).
effects: Some of the fusil cream side effects are mentioned below.It can cause skin redness, itching, and skin rashes in some patients.Patients having hypersensitivity problems with this medicine may notice the side effects, including burning skin and swelling.Mild irritation at area of application, Pain (only when medication is applied to deep leg ulcers), Symptoms of an eye infection (e.g., pink or red eyes, itchy eyes, eye discharge, crusts on the eyelids or lashes), Skin blistering may occur.

title: Bepanthin Plus 30G Cream
details: This medication is used as a moisturizer to treat or prevent dry, rough, scaly, itchy skin and minor skin irritations (e.g., diaper rash, skin burns from radiation therapy).
precautions: Before using this product, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to any of the ingredients in the product; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. If you have any of the following health problems, consult your doctor or pharmacist before using this product skin cuts/infections/sores. Some products may worsen acne. If your skin is prone to acne breakouts, look for the word "non-comedogenic" (will not clog pores) on the label. Some products may stain/discolor clothing. Ask your doctor or pharmacist for more details. Some ingredients (e.g., preservatives, fragrance) may make you more sensitive to the sun. Check the label for any warnings or ask your doctor or pharmacist if you need to take any specialprecautions when in the sun. Your doctor/pharmacist may suggest that you limit your time in the sun, avoid tanning booths and sunlamps, and use sunscreen and wear protective clothing when outdoors. Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness.Ask your pharmacist or healthcare provider before using any medications
effects: Most emollients can be used safely and effectively with no side effects. However, burning, stinging, redness, or irritation may occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

precautions: During treatment with this drug to avoid renewed infection, personal linen (facecloth, towels, underwears if possible of cotton) should be changed daily and boiled. Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Skin irritation, Redness, Dryness may occur at the site of application.

title: Mupir 15G Oint
details: It is used to treat certain skin infections (such as impetigo)
precautions: Avoid using this medication around your eyes, nose, mouth, or on large areas of damaged or broken skin unless otherwise directed by your doctor. If you accidentally get it in your eyes, nose, or mouth, rinse well with plenty of water. Discontinue use in event of sensitization or severe local irritation from ointment. Use of this medication for prolonged or repeated periods may result in a new skin infectioncaused by fungus or yeast. Tell your doctor right away if you notice signs of a new infection, or if your current infection does not get better or if it gets worse. Use this medication only on the skin. Clean and dry the affected area first. Then apply a small amount of ointment to the area as directed by your doctor, usually 3 times a day. You may cover the treated area with a bandage.
effects: It can cause itching, burning, or stinging, runny nose etc

title: Kenacomb 20G Cream
formula: Nystatin, neomycin sulfate, gramicidin, & triamcinolone acetonide
details: The brand name of this ointment is the Kenacomb. The formula and the active ingredients in it are the Triamcinolone acetonide, Neomycin, Gramicidin, and Nystatin. It is an anti-bacterial medicine, which is used to treat the infection.It works by the READ MORE
precautions: Consult a doctor if the patient is having any serious issues and check the medical history of the patient before recommending the Kenacomb cream. The patients having the problem like Chickenpox, diabetes, renal, hepatic problem or having a history of TB should stop using it slowly.The patients with affectability to Neomycin, weakened gastrointestinal motility, parkinsonism, and renal (kidney) debilitation. Additionally, kindly don't get any vaccine while utilizing this medication as it lessens the effectiveness.The cream may cause an allergic reaction as some inactive ingredients are there, such as thimerosal. This drug may cause eyesight problems like blurred vision. It is contraindicated in case of hypersensitivity to the active ingredient and children under 6 years.The patients with hypersensitivity to any of the medication's parts, renal, and hepatic hindrance, breastfeeding patients should utilize this cream cautiously. Kindly consult a doctor or any primary care physician for additional direction.It ought to hence be used with caution and safety during the pregnancy, and just if it benefits the mother, exceed any dangers to the embryo.
effects: Every medicine, including the Kenacomb cream, have some side effects, some are very serious, and some are not. Consult a doctor or any health care center if the condition gets worse or if the patient is not feeling well while using it.These are some of the side effects that may causeStretch marksItching and redness of the skinSkin RashesSkin drynessHair growth problemAcne spotsIrritation of skinSkin tone changesConsult a doctor if these severe problems occurEye problems like blurred visionHearing problems like hearing ringing soundsHivesUrine problem (passing of less urine than normal)Difficulty in breathingSwelling of body parts (face, tongue, lips)Side effects that may occur in ChildrenProblems in growth and weight gainHeadacheBulging or swelling spots in the skullSkin irritation, Burning, Dryness.

title: Melas H 15G Cream
formula:
Fusidic Acid and Hydrocortisone, Topical
Atco Lab
details:
Melas H cream belongs to the category of ointments that are used to treat infection or inflammation. It is a steroid so it should be used in limited quantities. It is made with a combination of two substances which are Fusidic Acid + Hydrocortiso

READ MORE
precautions: Before using the ointment. It is important to check the leaflet and read the list of instructions carefully, also check the list of ingredients and in case you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in it. Do not use the ointment.Do not use the ointment for an extended period because it may cause skin sensitivity.Pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers should only use the ointment when it is needed and on doctor's prescription only.This ointment may make your skin sensitive. Limit your exposure to the sunlight after applying the ointment.Do not use the expired ointment.Keep the ointment away from children’s reachStore it in a cool and dry place.Always wash your hands before using it. Unless you're using the cream or ointment to treat your hands, always wash your hands afterwards too. Remove the cap. Check the seal isn't broken before you first use the cream or ointment. Then push the spike in the cap through the seal on the tube. If you are using the cream or ointment when breastfeeding, be careful not to get any on your breasts. If you do, make sure to wash it off thoroughly before feeding your child. A course of treatment typically lasts around seven days. You should not use the cream or ointment for longer than ten days. Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Likewise, every other product also has some side effects. However, everyone doesn't need to experience the same side effects. Following are some of the side effects associated with the use of this medication. In case, any of these side-effects appear immediately, stop using the ointment. And in case the skin conditions get worse or do not heal at all after using the ointment immediately stop using the ointment and seek medical assistance. DrynessIrritation or rednessBurning sensationEczemaAppearance of blistersStinging sensationSkin sensitivitySkin thinningDiscolorationAppearance of rashesSwellingAllergic reaction from the ointment may cause the following conditionsSore throatChest tighteningPale skinSwelling on the face, tongue, or any other body part.Increased thirstFrequent urination or urinary retentionWeakness or fatigueSudden weight lossPersistent HeadacheThese side-effects must not be ignored. In case any of these appear, immediately seek medical assistance.

title: Nerisone Forte 10G Oint
details: It is used to reduce redness and to relieve inflammation and itching associated with skin conditions such as those caused by contact or allergic dermatitis (eczema), seborrheic dermatitis, and psoriasis.
precautions: Do not use this medication to treat skin conditions on children under 12 months of age. Do not stop using this medication without consulting your doctor. Apply a thin film to the affected areas 1 to 2 times daily, according to the doctor's instructions. Ask your pharmacist or healthcare provider before using any medication. Do not give this medication to anyone else, even if they have the same symptoms as you do.

precautions: Tell your physician whether:You're pregnant, or you plan on getting pregnant.Any other medications or chemicals you allergic toDo not use fucicort on your forehead.Long-term continued treatment, especially in the face, on flexures and delicate areas as well as on children and infants, should be avoided. They are more likely if they do.Inflammation of the skinA weakening of the eczemaSense of burningRedness of the eyesSwelling or tiny bumps.Increased body hair growthSide effects are rare (probably affect less than 1 in 100 people), but be vigilant if you notice any skin rash or inflammation after using this Cream.

title: Fucidin H 15G Cream
formula:
Fusidic Acid and Hydrocortisone, Topical
Leo Pharma
details: It is used to treat various skin infections caused by certain kinds of bacteria. Such infections may include impetigo and secondary infections (infections that develop after the skin has been injured) to burns or broken skin.
precautions: This products should not be used by anyone who is, Allergic to fusidic acid and its salts or to any of the ingredients of this medication or is Allergic to lanolin (for the ointment form only).
effects: Mild irritation at area of application, Pain (only when medication is applied to deep leg ulcers), Symptoms of an eye infection (e.g., pink or red eyes, itchy eyes, eye discharge, crusts on the eyelids or lashes), Skin blistering may occur.

title: Eflogen 15G Cream
details: It is used to reduce unwanted facial hair in women
precautions: Before using this product, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to eflornithine; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients (such as methylparaben), which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of cuts/infections/sores on face. This drug is not for use in children younger than 12 years.
effects: Burning, stinging, tingling, and redness of the skin may occur. If these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor.

title: Fucidin 250MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat Eczema or Dermatitis and also Infected by Bacteria.
precautions: Fucidin tablets contain lactose and are not suitable for people with rare hereditary problems of galactose intolerance, the Lapp lactose deficiency or glucose-galactose malabsorption. This medicine may pass into breast milk in small amounts. It should only be used during breastfeeding if the benefit to the mother outweighs any potential risk to the nursing infant.
effects: Heart burn, Nausea, Vomiting may occur.
